intro: Schaueria parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved schaueria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Schaueria parvifolia typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and vibrant blooms.
